Description: Ostracon (?), fragment of the upper-body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is greyish in section, the interior is encrusted with a grey-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown slip, remains of one line of red-painted cursive text and another line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394890) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394890)
